title: Crooksbury Hill Walking Route

images.title: Diane Sambrook / Trig Point on Crooksbury Hill
images.caption: Trig Point on Crooksbury Hill

images.title: Colin Smith / Soldiers Ring, Crooksbury Hill
images.caption: Soldiers Ring, Crooksbury Hill. Ancient earthwork which is well hidden in the pinewood. The sandy soils of the hill are evident in the many bridle paths here.

images.title: Diane Sambrook / Woodland on Crooksbury Common
images.caption: Woodland on Crooksbury Common - you can take a short detour from this route to further explore the common which surrounds the hill

images.title: Diane Sambrook / Heathland at Crooksbury Common
images.caption: Heathland at Crooksbury Common

images.title: Colin Smith / Crooksbury Common
images.caption: Crooksbury Common. On the bridleway just north of the Crooksbury Hill transmitter tower. Note the bamboo growing beside the track.

description: This short circular walk climbs to Crooksbury Hill near Farnham in Surrey. There's a car park directly below the hill where you can pick up a short trail to take you to the hill summit. From here you can enjoy fine views over the surrounding countryside of the North Downs. The route then descends through the pine woodland to the ancient earthwork at Soldiers Ring. You can then follow a bridleway south and then west to return you to the car park. You can extend the walk by heading a short distance south east to Crooksbury Common. Here you'll find some nice woodland and heathland to explore.
